overview.title: What is Naruto Mythos TCG?
overview.desc: A 2-player strategy card game where you are a Kage sending ninjas on missions. Win by earning the most mission points across 4 turns.
overview.bubble1: Two players compete as rival Kage
overview.bubble3: Win missions to earn points. The player with the most points after 4 turns wins!

cardAnatomy.title: Card Anatomy
cardAnatomy.desc: Understanding the parts of a character card.
cardAnatomy.nameBubble: The character's name. Only one character with the same name per mission per player.
cardAnatomy.titleBubble: Distinguishes different versions of the same character. Same name but different title means a different card.
cardAnatomy.chakraBubble: The amount of chakra you must spend to play this card face-visible onto the field.
cardAnatomy.powerBubble: Base strength of this card. The player with more total power on a mission wins it.
cardAnatomy.effectsBubble: Card abilities: MAIN (when played), UPGRADE (when evolving), AMBUSH (when revealed from hidden), SCORE (when winning a mission).
cardAnatomy.rarityBubble: How rare and powerful the card is: Common (C), Uncommon (UC), Rare (R), Rare Art (RA), Secret (S), Mythos (M).

turnStructure.title: Turn Structure
turnStructure.desc: Each of the 4 turns follows a 4-phase sequence.
turnStructure.start: Start Phase: Reveal a mission, gain chakra (5 + 1/character), draw 2 cards
turnStructure.action: Action Phase: Take turns playing cards, revealing characters, or passing
turnStructure.mission: Mission Phase: Compare power on each mission, award points
turnStructure.end: End Phase: Discard chakra, remove all Power tokens

special.powerTokens: Power Tokens: Added by POWERUP. Removed every End Phase.
special.deckRules: Deck: Min 30 characters, max 2 copies per version, exactly 3 missions.

gameplay.title: Play a Full Game
gameplay.desc: Follow a guided walkthrough of a complete turn.
gameplay.step0Bubble: Both players draw 5 cards. Each player can mulligan once: return all cards and draw 5 new ones.
gameplay.step1Bubble: A new mission is revealed! This is a D-rank mission (+1 point). Each turn adds a new mission to the board.
gameplay.step2Bubble: You gain 5 chakra (+1 per character in play) and draw 2 cards. On the first turn you have no characters yet, so you get exactly 5.
gameplay.step3Bubble: You play Naruto face-visible on the mission. Pay 3 chakra (5 to 2). His MAIN effect activates when played face-visible.
gameplay.step4Bubble: Opponent plays a character hidden for 1 chakra. No effects activate. You cannot see what card it is.
gameplay.step5Bubble: Both players pass. The first player to pass gets the Edge token for the next turn. The Edge token breaks ties and determines who plays first.
gameplay.step6Bubble: Mission scoring! Your Naruto has 3 power. Hidden characters have 0 power. You win the mission and earn +1 point (D-rank bonus).
gameplay.step7Bubble: End of turn. All remaining chakra is discarded to 0. All Power tokens are removed from characters. The next turn begins!

q1.text: How many turns in a game?
q1.exp: A full game consists of exactly 4 turns.

q2.text: How many cards does each player draw during the Start Phase?
q2.exp: Each player draws 2 cards at the start of each turn.

q3.text: What is the base chakra gained each turn (before bonuses)?
q3.exp: Each player gains 5 base chakra plus 1 per character in play.

q4.text: How much chakra to play a character hidden (face-down)?
q4.exp: Playing hidden always costs exactly 1 chakra.

q5.text: What happens to Power tokens at end of turn?
q5.exp: All Power tokens are removed during the End Phase.

q6.text: How many mission cards does each player select?
q6.exp: Each player selects 3 mission cards during setup.

q7.exp: The Edge token holder wins all ties.

q8.text: Minimum character cards in a deck?
q8.exp: A deck must contain at least 30 character cards.

q9.text: Max copies of the same card version in a deck?
q9.exp: Maximum 2 copies of the same version.

q10.text: Who receives the Edge token during the Action Phase?
q10.exp: The first player to pass takes the Edge token.

q11.text: What power do hidden characters have for scoring?
q11.exp: Hidden characters have 0 power for scoring.

q12.text: In what order are missions scored?
q12.exp: Missions are scored from D to C to B to A.

q13.text: Rank bonus for a rank B mission?

q14.text: When does a MAIN effect trigger?
q14.exp: MAIN triggers on face-visible play and when revealing hidden characters.

q15.text: When does an AMBUSH effect trigger?
q15.oB: Only when revealing a hidden character
q15.exp: AMBUSH only triggers when revealing a hidden character.

q16.text: Minimum total power to win a mission?
q16.exp: A player needs at least 1 power to win.

q17.text: What happens when a player's deck is empty?
q17.exp: Empty deck = simply don't draw. No penalty.

q18.exp: Upgrade cost = new cost minus old cost.

q19.text: Can two hidden same-name characters share a mission?
q19.exp: Two hidden same-name cards can coexist until revealed.

q20.exp: Power tokens transfer to the new card.

q21.oC: Playing over a same-name lower-cost character
q21.exp: UPGRADE triggers only when upgrading over a same-name lower-cost character.

q22.text: Same name, different titles — same mission?
q22.oB: No, one name per mission per player
q22.exp: One character per name per mission regardless of title.

q23.exp: The [⧗] symbol marks a continuous effect.

q24.text: What mission rank appears on turn 1?

q25.text: Who chooses the order when multiple effects trigger simultaneously?
q25.exp: The active player chooses resolution order.

q26.text: What does CHAKRA +X mean on a character?
q26.oB: Provides X extra chakra during Start Phase
q26.exp: CHAKRA +X provides extra chakra during Start Phase.

q27.text: When a controlled enemy card leaves play, where does it go?
q27.exp: Cards return to their original owner's discard pile.

q28.text: Do hidden characters provide chakra during Start Phase?
q28.exp: Hidden characters count for the +1 chakra per character.

q30.text: When a character is upgraded, what happens to old effects?
q30.exp: Only the new (top) card's effects apply.

q31.text: When can the Mulligan be performed?
q31.exp: Mulligan can only be done once during setup.

q32.text: After one player passes, can the other keep acting?
q32.oD: Yes, multiple actions until they pass
q32.exp: The remaining player can take multiple actions.

q33.text: Are effects optional or mandatory by default?
q33.exp: Effects are optional unless the text says 'you must'.

q34.text: Existing cards vs newly played card — whose effects resolve first?
q34.exp: Effects on existing cards resolve before the new card's effects.

q35.text: What is required to upgrade a character?
q35.oB: Same name and strictly higher cost
q35.exp: Same name + strictly higher chakra cost.

q36.text: Do SCORE effects require any condition?
q36.oB: Must have 1+ power to win and trigger
q36.exp: Need at least 1 power to win and trigger SCORE.

q37.text: Both players have 0 power on a mission?
q37.exp: If both have 0 power, no one wins.

q38.text: Are Rare Art cards a different version from base?
q38.exp: Rare Art variants are NOT a different version.

q39.text: What happens when revealing a hidden character?
q39.exp: Revealing triggers both MAIN and AMBUSH effects.

q40.text: End of turn 4 with equal scores?
q40.exp: If tied after turn 4, Edge token holder wins.
